message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.IT. 

The paper addresses the problem of unsupervised disentanglement of latent representations learnt via deep generative models, which is a topic that falls under the broad category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper proposes a novel approach to enforcing statistical independence in the latent space of VAEs, which involves augmenting the standard VAE with an inverse-Wishart (IW) prior on the covariance matrix of the latent code. This approach is likely to be of interest to researchers working on unsupervised learning and generative models in artificial intelligence (cs.AI), as well as those working on computer vision (cs.CV) and neural networks (cs.NE). The paper also involves some technical aspects related to Bayesian inference and information theory, which could make it relevant to researchers in the field of information theory (cs.IT).
